channel.title: Private Server Hosting on server?
channel.description:
Okay basically my question is how do I run a Private server off my server? I don't want to have to have my computer on 24/7. As private servers need .cmd to start the server how would I go about doing this?
I have a godaddy hosting server not dedicated, but the server does have a ip address (duhh.. ) Would I still need to use no-ip?
The end result will be php & mysql working together with in-game java.
Thanks ahead of time to those who end up solving my problem.
Please note that I have spent the last few hours reading on private servers and what not so my understanding of the whole concept isn't so great. If you could just point me in the right direction that would help me out very much! Thanks

item.title: Private Server Hosting on server?
item.dc:creator: @lil_wayne612 lil wayne612
item.description:
@lil_wayne612 wrote:

YOU CAN TO RUN YOUR SERVER OFF YOUR VPS THATS WHAT IM DOING.

Read full topic

@NewbieNewty wrote:

item.title: Private Server Hosting on server?
item.dc:creator: @lil_wayne612 lil wayne612
item.description:
@lil_wayne612 wrote:

change port to 43594, then apply, okay. Then get on your vps, download your source, new java, winrar. Then open your server files double click run, then open no-ip then utoruuent. And it runs off godaddy. Just dont logg off your vps at the top theres a x - [], click the x and then clikc okay.

Read full topic

item.title: Private Server Hosting on server?
item.dc:creator: @hypercomps hypercomps
item.description:
@hypercomps wrote:

To check my server port how do I go about that?
Also how do I start server? I am using this source code http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,367385.0.html
I have uploaded all the files I extracted from the .rar file, all files are located on my server.

I have added the port value of 43594, now what?

Thanks again guys, sorry for asking so much just need to know so I can get started. =]

Oh sorry also, does my computer need to be on for server to be on if I am running if off my godaddy hosting?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 19, 2009, 04:54:32 pm[/size][hr]I am trying to connect to the files at http://gscaper.no-ip.biz/ but its not working with the files uploaded to my server.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 19, 2009, 10:57:54 pm[/size][hr]Anyone can you help?
I uploaded the files bin, cmd, and src.
Once these are uploaded to my godaddy account how do I start the private server?
I have no-ip already too.
I also have utorrent and I have changed its port to 43594 but still dont know what to do after doing this… help please =/

Read full topic

item.title: Private Server Hosting on server?
item.dc:creator: @vamp256 vamp256
item.description:
@vamp256 wrote:

in preferences, Set the port value to 43594, or what ever your servers port is.

Read full topic

item.title: Private Server Hosting on server?
item.dc:creator: @hypercomps hypercomps
item.description:
@hypercomps wrote:

Thanks but could someone walk me through a little more?

I currently have UTorrent open, and I opened up preferences; what do I do in there now?
Do I need to still install the JDK update to my computer if I am running it off my server and not my computer?

All my Private servers source files are uploaded to my server.
I have no-ip also, registered and everything is set up.
To get Server running what exactly do I do?

Thank you guys for all your time spent helping me!

Read full topic

item.title: Private Server Hosting on server?
item.dc:creator: @lil_wayne612 lil wayne612
item.description:
@lil_wayne612 wrote:

utorruet is pretty much like portforwarding, what you do with utorruet is open it up after downloaded, at the very top look at each option, there should be like settings or something. But look for prefrences or something like that. and yes just upload your source files to your vps. You want link to utorruet or not?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 19, 2009, 10:52:37 am[/size][hr]wait when your in prefrences go to connection, and make shure that the port is 43954 like all the other servers the apply and okay.

Read full topic

item.title: Private Server Hosting on server?
item.dc:creator: @hypercomps hypercomps
item.description:
@hypercomps wrote:

Hmm alright I am trying to grasp this concept. So I would upload my Runescape Private “Source Code” to my Godaddy server? Then connect using UTorrent then no-ip after that?

If so I am not understanding what UTorrent exactly is doing?

Thank you for you help =]

Read full topic

item.title: Private Server Hosting on server?
item.dc:creator: @lil_wayne612 lil wayne612
item.description:
@lil_wayne612 wrote:

yes, I have godaddy as well what i do is, download utorrut and then go to no-ip.com . First run your server then open utorruet then no-ip. Then it should be on
